intro: Phanera semibifida, commonly known as the two-lobed phanera, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Phanera semibifida is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
